title: why am i being forced in taking a yellow trinket if i dont get one from the store

replies.body: League of Legends is autocorrecting your mistake :>
its not a mistake, im being forced to pick one

Clarify something for me.

By "being forced to pick one", are you saying that you've chosen a different trinket but the game changes it to the yellow trinket, or are you saying that you *don't* choose *any* trinket and the game gives you a yellow trinket?

im saying i dont want any of them but im being forced to 
take the yellow

So basically, you're complaining because you're actively choosing to ignore a very important aspect of the game and being encouraged by Riot to actually use trinkets for the sole purpose they exist, being vision control?

Sounds like you're just making up problems, honestly.
Same guy who wants to take Aftershock on Tryn and Yi lol, I'm with Rogue on this one.

really? there has been 40 min games where a player put down 1 or 2 trinkets, are they making the problem. ive seen games where a mid player never used the ignite they took. i think you present a good point but if the issues is about important (winning) aspects of the game then how far will this go?
teemo jungle isnt technically a winning aspect based on what pros play but ive seen it and have won with a player on my team using it. and ive played games with aftershock tryn i think and won with it. 
if this continues then as time goes i see it very limiting to players.

That is because you are playing in bronze 5. Players at that elo are lacking in knowledge about the game, or perhave, choose to ignored the prober way to play. They tend to think they can become hero that can 1v5 with any builds. And will go to substantial amounts of distant, to defend themself on their comprehension.

It is similar to how an "How the fuck did you got pass screening process" intern, like to think they are the next big thing. Coming in with all these "great" ideas and will go that extra mile to support it. While not knowing any indepth details which might give them the insight why it would be a bad idea. 

So, am curious. Are you setting a challenge for yourself. To see if you can climb a mountain with a broken arm kind of thing?

The *only* reason, and I reiterate: the ***only*** reason, that vision control isn't essential to winning in low elo (and mid elo, and probably some points in high elo too), is that people don't do anything with it. Even so, it's a fundamental aspect of basically every MOBA out there, and should *not* be taken for granted. Good vision control can significantly increase your chances of winning, even when outmatched (and, yes, even when you are the only one actually considering it).

*plays Teemo*

*Riot changes it to Quinn*

Autocorrecting my mistake.
